channel.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

item.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - Revision of Linux Distribution Reinstallation
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT May 13, 09:00 - 09:30 UTC

Apr 18, 10:07 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on Bare Metal servers.

This may affect functionality.

Start time : 13/05/2024 09:00 UTC
End time : 13/05/2024 09:30 UTC
Service impact : permanent unavailability of the current distribution upon reinstallation of your dedicated servers.
Service improvement : As part of improving and simplifying the use of our products, we are updating the list of Linux distributions available when installing your dedicated servers.
For more details, please refer to this link

item.title: [RBX1/RBX2][Dedicated Servers] - Servers migration from RBX1 to RBX2
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 28, 22:00 UTC  -  May 2, 05:00 UTC

Apr 11, 22:52 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Bare metal offer.

This may temporarily affect Availability.

Start time : 28/04/2024 22:00 UTC
End time : 02/05/2024 05:00 UTC
Service impact : Servers being moved from RBX1 to RBX2 might be unavailable for up to 7 hours during the night (22:00 UTC => 05:00 UTC).
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our network infrastructure, we will have to move servers from RBX1 to RBX2 due to the EoL (End of life) of RBX1.

Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: [GLOBAL][Dedicated Servers] - Windows OS language API change
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 24, 13:00 - 13:15 UTC

May 14, 08:30 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Dedicated Servers offer.

Start time : 14/05/2024 08:30 UTC
End time : 14/05/2024 08:45 UTC
Service impact : No impact expected.
Customers not installing any Windows OSes from API and/or installing Windows OSes from OVHcloud control panel are not affected by this change.
Customers using that API call for installing any windows OSes in a display language other English are affected by this change and need to update their scripts and applications accordingly.
Service improvement : The following API call with details/language attribute within the payload will definitely stop working: POST /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/install/start

Below you can find an example of payload that will stop working for a win2022-dc OS installation:
```json
{
"details": {
"language": "fr",
},
"templateName": "win2022-dc_64"
}
```

With the previous example, here is the target payload that customer can already use and that will continue to work:
```json
{
"userMetadata": [
{
"key": "language",
"value": "fr-fr"
}
],
"templateName": "win2022-dc_64"
}
```

More details and examples can be found in the Documentation Page

Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: [RBX7][Storage and Backups] - NAS HA maintenance notification
item.description:
Apr 23, 13:34 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Apr 23, 11:30 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Apr 15, 21:41 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our storage and backups offer.

This may temporarily affect availability.

Start time : 23/04/2024 11:30 UTC
End time : 23/04/2024 13:30 UTC
Service impact : Impacted services might experience some input/output freezes for storage equipment during the maintenance.
Service improvement : : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will perform an update on the storage servers hosting your data.
This version will improve certain security mechanisms, as well as some performance enhancements.
During the maintenance period, your data will remain available.

Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - APIv6 BringYourOwnImage routes operation
item.description:
Apr 23, 09:05 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Apr 23, 08:30 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Mar 6, 15:16 UTC
Update - New start time : 23/04/2024 08:30 UTC
New end time : 23/04/2024 08:45 UTC
Service impact : Some API calls definitely removed.

Mar 6, 10:57 UTC
Update - We will be undergoing scheduled maintenance during this time.

Feb 14, 00:54 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Dedicated Servers offer.

Start time : 19/03/2024 09:30 UTC
End time : 19/03/2024 09:45 UTC
Service impact : Some API calls definitely removed.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our servers, this maintenance will enables customers to deploy cloudready images directly on their dedicated server.

The following API calls will be definitely removed:

GET /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/bringYourOwnImage

POST /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/bringYourOwnImage

DELETE /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/bringYourOwnImage

Customers can still use the Bring Your Own Image (BYOI) feature from the API call POST /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/install/start. More details can be found in the documentation page.
This change was required in order to add the new Bring Your Own Linux (BYOLinux) feature.
Bring Your Own Image (BYOI) / Bring Your Own Linux (BYOLinux), a comparison sheet - OVHcloud.

item.title: [RBX2][Dedicated Servers] - Network Disruption
item.description:
Apr 23, 03:09 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 10/04/2024 23:16 UTC
End time : 23/04/2024 02:56 UTC
Root cause : Incident due to a hardware issue.
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Apr 19, 16:39 UTC
Update - Our technical teams will implement the current maintenance to solve the incident.

Apr 12, 16:46 UTC
Update - Update : Additional maintenance is required to resolve the issue definitively. This will be scheduled for early next week. We will get back to you early next week to let you know when the work will be carried out.

Apr 12, 14:54 UTC
Identified - Start time : 10/04/2024 23:16 UTC
Service impact : Your services may have experienced latency and packet loss on the RBX2 baremetal infrastructure.
Root cause : Incident due to a hardware issue
Ongoing actions : Our technical teams will carry out curative maintenance with no impact on your services to fix the issue.
